basics.name: Kevin Nguyen
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Fall, 2021.

work.summary: Assist user's with tech support needs.
highlights: Troubleshoot software, hardware and networking issues over the phone
Answer phone and email responses to the ITS Help Desk

work.summary: Direct a team of employees to keep customers safe as they have fun.
highlights: In charge of maintenance and inventory.
Make business calls and emails as well as write passdowns for the following leads.
In charge of training new employees.
Cash handling by making deposits and make sure tills are set for the next business day.

volunteer.organization: Team Kanaloa - Unmanned X Systems VIP
volunteer.summary: The RIP Labâ€™s Unmanned X Systems (UXS) research group, or Team Kanaloa, is a Vertically Integrated Project (VIP) aimed towards the advancement of Unmanned Systems technologies.
highlights: Virtual Competitions hosted by Open Source Robotics Foundation
Running the vehicle autonomously in simulation
Technology Incubation, Demonstration and Experimentation Support (TIDES)

volunteer.summary: Teach students about safety, machinery, and design process.
highlights: Teach students to think outside the box to solve problems.
Teach students how to use machinery (ex. Mills) in a safe and proper manner.
Ensure students are always dressed properly to avoid injuries.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Given to students with a 3.5 GPA or higher as a full-time student for the semester.

awards.title: FIRST Robotics Regional Winners
awards.summary: Awarded to the winning alliance composed of three teams allowing them to qualify for championships.
